clustering.sfcm
Class SFCMManager

java.lang.Object
  clustering.sfcm.SFCMManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
ClusteringDelegate
public class SFCMManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClusteringDelegate

This class isolates the Spatial Fuzzy C-Means Algorithm (SFC) making it independent from using the ImageJ API. It takes the responsibility to run it and to communicate the results to the SFCMPlugin class. It also provides a way to encode the input image in a different color space and to decode the clustered image in several ways. The class conforms to the @link{ClusteringDelegate} interface, implementing the delegation pattern and allowing the delegating algorithm to communicate with the plugin. Optionally it can be instantiated by the @link{TestManager} to execute some tests

See Also:
SFCM, ClusteringDelegate, SFCMPlugin, TestManager

          Encodes an image into a RGB colored images according to the clustering results, it assigns each cluster a random generated color using @link{ColorManger} and each pixel will assume the color of the cluster it belongs to.

          Encodes an image into a RGB colored images according to the clustering results, each pixel will assume the RGB color of the centroid whose cluster it belongs to.

run

public ij.ImageStack[] run(ij.ImagePlus img)
The main method of the class. It encapsulates the @link{SFCM} run. It takes an @link{ImagePlus} and converts it into a @link{VectorProcessor}, provides the conversion into another color space and extracts the pixel in a data matrix form in order to run the SFCM algorithm. Once the algorithm terminated, it encodes new images based on the clustering partition obtained and the visualization mode specified.

Parameters:
img - the currently opened image in ImageJ
Returns:
and array of @link{ImageStack} containing the encoded clustered images
See Also:
SFCM, SFCMPlugin, VectorProcessor, computeInitializationMode(), computeSpatialFunctionMode(), computeStopCriterion(), convertMatrixColorSpace(float[][], java.lang.String), convertToColorSpace(ij.ImagePlus, java.lang.String)

convertToColorSpace

private VectorProcessor convertToColorSpace(ij.ImagePlus imp,
                                            java.lang.String colorSpace)
Converts the @link{ImagePlus} received in input into the color space specified by the input string. If the string equals "None" then no color space conversion is applied and the image is converted into a float stack. To convert the color space it calls some utility methods from

Parameters:
imp - the image to convert
colorSpace - the string specifying the color space for the conversion. Allowed values are: "None", "XYZ", "L*a*b*", "HSB"
Returns:
a VectorProcessor representing the converted image
See Also:
ColorSpaceConversion, convertToFloatStack(ij.ImagePlus), convertToHSBFloatStack(ij.ImagePlus)

computeStopCriterion

private int computeStopCriterion()
Computes an integer encoding the stop criterion type currently chosen. It throws an exception if no valid criterion is chosen.

Returns:
an integer representing the stop criterion

encodeClusteredImageInGray

private ij.process.ByteProcessor encodeClusteredImageInGray(VectorProcessor vp,
                                                            int[][] clusterMemberships,
                                                            float[][] clusterCenters)
Encodes the input images into a new one representing the clustering partition resulted from the algorithm by using a gray scaled image

Parameters:
vp - the @link{VectorProcessor} representing the original image
clusterMemberships - the clustering partition matrix
clusterCenters - the cluster center matrix
Returns:
a @link{ByteProcessor} containing the encoded image

encodeClusteredImageBinaryStack

private ij.ImageStack encodeClusteredImageBinaryStack(VectorProcessor vp,
                                                      int[][] clusterMemberships,
                                                      float[][] clusterCenters)
Encodes the input images into a new one representing the clustering partition resulted from the algorithm by using a stack whose slices are binary images representing the membership of a pixel to a specified cluster (each slice represents a different cluster)

Parameters:
vp - the @link{VectorProcessor} representing the original image
clusterMemberships - the clustering partition matrix
clusterCenters - the cluster center matrix
Returns:
an @link{ImageStack} containing the encoded binary stack

encodeClusteredImageFuzzyStack

private ij.ImageStack encodeClusteredImageFuzzyStack(VectorProcessor vp,
                                                     float[][] clusterMemberships,
                                                     float[][] clusterCenters)
Encodes the input images into a new one representing the fuzzy clustering partition resulted from the algorithm by using a stack whose slices are gray scaled images representing the fuzzy membership of a pixel to a specified cluster (each slice represents a different cluster)

Parameters:
vp - the @link{VectorProcessor} representing the original image
clusterMemberships - the fuzzy clustering membership matrix
clusterCenters - the cluster center matrix
Returns:
an @link{ImageStack} containing the encoded fuzzy stack

encodeClusteredImageInRGB

private ij.process.ColorProcessor encodeClusteredImageInRGB(VectorProcessor vp,
                                                            int[][] clusterMemberships,
                                                            float[][] clusterCenters,
                                                            int[] mixingColor,
                                                            int randomizationSeed)
Encodes an image into a RGB colored images according to the clustering results, it assigns each cluster a random generated color using @link{ColorManger} and each pixel will assume the color of the cluster it belongs to.

Parameters:
vp - the original image as a @link{VectorProcessor}
clusterMemberships - the cluster membership matrix
clusterCenters - the cluster center matrix
mixingColor - an optional color for mixing the random color sequence
randomizationSeed - an integer used to generate the random colors
Returns:
a @link{ColorProcessor} encoding the clustered image
See Also:
ColorManager

encodeClusteredImageWithClusterCenterColors

private ij.ImageStack encodeClusteredImageWithClusterCenterColors(VectorProcessor vp,
                                                                  int[][] clusterMemberships,
                                                                  float[][] clusterCenters)
Encodes an image into a RGB colored images according to the clustering results, each pixel will assume the RGB color of the centroid whose cluster it belongs to.

Parameters:
vp - the original image as a @link{VectorProcessor}
clusterMemberships - the cluster membership matrix
clusterCenters - the cluster center matrix
Returns:
an @link{ImageStack} encoding the RGB clustered image

convertMatrixColorSpace

private float[][] convertMatrixColorSpace(float[][] dataFeatureMatrix,
                                          java.lang.String colorSpace)
Converts a float sample x features matrix into the RGB color space according to the current color space expressed in the input string. Allowed values are: "None", "XYZ", "L*a*b*", "HSB". If "None", than no conversion is applied. It is called when it is necessary to encode the clustered matrix into a RGB image using the cluster centroids colors.

Parameters:
dataFeatureMatrix - the matrix representing the image converted
colorSpace - the color space from which convert the matrix back
Returns:
a float matrix resulting from the conversion
See Also:
encodeClusteredImageWithClusterCenterColors(vectorLib.VectorProcessor, int[][], float[][])

convertToFloatStack

private static ij.ImagePlus convertToFloatStack(ij.ImagePlus src)
Convert image to a stack of FloatProcessors.

Parameters:
src - image to convert.
Returns:
float stack.

convertToHSBFloatStack

private static ij.ImagePlus convertToHSBFloatStack(ij.ImagePlus src)
Converts an @link{ImagePlus} into a float stack representing the HSB conversion of the original image. Used when the HSB color space is chosen for representing the input image.

Parameters:
src - the original Image to convert
Returns:
the converted ImagePlus containing the float stack
See Also:
convertToColorSpace(ij.ImagePlus, java.lang.String)

updateStatus

public void updateStatus(float[][] V,
                         int[][] U,
                         long nIteration,
                         float errorJ,
                         float errorU,
                         float errorV)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Implements the ClusteringDelegate method of the same signature. Updates the ImageJ status showing a message containing the algorithm updated status and information on the matrixes and the iteration errors obtained by checking the convergence. Optionally displays the message on the system console and writes the results on a file if testing

Specified by:
updateStatus in interface ClusteringDelegate
Parameters:
V - the optional cluster center matrix (not used)
U - the optional cluster membership matrix (not used)
nIteration - the current iteration
errorJ - the current error in the objective function
errorU - the current error computed on the matrix U
errorV - the current error computed on the matrix V
Throws:
java.io.IOException - exception thrown while trying to write on file
See Also:
RAF, ClusteringDelegate, printOnConsole

testingValidation

public void testingValidation(double m,
                              double p,
                              double q,
                              int rad,
                              java.lang.String init,
                              java.lang.String spatialFunction,
                              int k,
                              java.lang.String colorSpace,
                              double vpc,
                              double vpe,
                              double vxb)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Writes on the RAF file the sequence of parameters when a validation test is run after the @link{SFCM} algorithm finished.

Parameters:
m - the fuzzyness value used
p - the membership weight value used
q - the spatial function weight value used
rad - the window radius used
init - the initialization criterion used
spatialFunction - the spatial function chosen
k - the used number of cluster
colorSpace - the color space used
vpc - the partition coefficient computed for validating the algorithm
vpe - the partition entropy value computed for validation
vxb - the xie and benn's index computed for validation
Throws:
java.io.IOException - an exception if it it not posisble to write on the file
See Also:
RAF, validation, run(ij.ImagePlus), #TestManager, ClusterValidity
